intro: Labillardiera longiflora, commonly known as the long-flowered labillardiera, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slight aromatic scent. Labillardiera longiflora is typically found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to thrive in arid and semi-arid environments.
